evidence_snippet: This paper is about Alzheimer's disease and brain metabolism prediction using FDG-PET imaging. There is no mention of Crohn's disease, MRI scoring systems (Van Assche, MAGNIFI-CD, etc.), or any related gastrointestinal imaging or clinical outcomes.
extraction_notes: Paper is completely unrelated to Crohn's disease or MRI-based scoring systems. It focuses on Alzheimer's disease and FDG-PET imaging for brain metabolism prediction. No relevant data could be extracted for the MRI-Crohn Atlas schema.

evidence_snippet: This paper focuses on developing and validating an ultrasound activity score (SUS-CD) for Crohn's disease. It mentions MRI-based scoring systems like MaRIA in the introduction but does not use or compare any MRI scoring systems in its methodology or results.
extraction_notes: Paper is about ultrasound scoring (SUS-CD), not MRI scoring. Mentions MRI indices (MaRIA, simplified MaRIA) only in background/references. No MRI data or comparisons between MRI scoring systems are presented.

evidence_snippet: This paper describes fluid-structure interaction modeling of an arteriovenous fistula using PC-MRA data from a 1.5T MRI scanner. It is focused on hemodynamics and computational modeling, not on Crohn's disease, MRI scoring systems, or clinical outcomes related to inflammatory bowel disease.
extraction_notes: Paper is about arteriovenous fistulas for hemodialysis, not Crohn's disease. No MRI scoring systems for Crohn's disease are mentioned. No patient population data, clinical outcomes, or scoring system correlations relevant to Crohn's disease are present.

evidence_snippet: This paper is about a technical image enhancement algorithm (G-CLAHE) for X-ray images. It contains no mention of Crohn's disease, MRI, or any MRI scoring systems (Van Assche, MAGNIFI-CD, etc.). The content is purely focused on computer vision/image processing methodology.
extraction_notes: Paper is irrelevant to the MRI-Crohn Atlas extraction task. It discusses X-ray image enhancement, not MRI or Crohn's disease. No clinical or scoring data to extract.

evidence_snippet: This paper is about condensed matter physics and optical spectroscopy of the material PdTe2, discussing van Hove singularities, scattering rates, and superconductivity. It contains no mention of Crohn's disease, MRI, or any clinical scoring systems.
extraction_notes: Paper is completely unrelated to Crohn's disease or MRI research. It is a physics paper about Dirac semi-metals and superconductivity. No clinical data can be extracted.

evidence_snippet: This paper is about pure simplicial complexes in combinatorial commutative algebra, specifically the van der Waerden complex. It contains no clinical data, MRI scoring systems, or patient information related to Crohn's disease.
extraction_notes: Paper is purely mathematical, focusing on properties of simplicial complexes (vertex decomposable, shellable, Cohen-Macaulay). No clinical or MRI data present.

evidence_snippet: The total MRE score (8.0 ± 3.9 vs. 5.7 ± 3.4, p < 0.001) decreased significantly during follow-up. Changes in total MRE score were negatively correlated with SMI changes (r = − 0.408, p < 0.01) but positively correlated with VA/TA index changes (r = 0.479, p < 0.01).

clinical_remission_definition: feeling well, 1-2 bowel movements per day without blood, denied abdominal pain, urgency, nocturnal awakenings, or difficulty urinating
evidence_snippet: This case report describes the novel use of infliximab as maintenance therapy for both Crohn disease and idiopathic retroperitoneal fibrosis in a patient with concurrent disease. A 34-year-old man with Crohn disease developed a pelvic mass and hydroureteronephrosis, leading to an idiopathic retroperitoneal fibrosis diagnosis.
extraction_notes: This is a single case report focused on a novel therapeutic application. No MRI scoring systems (Van Assche, MAGNIFI-CD, etc.) are mentioned or used. The paper describes clinical and imaging improvement but does not quantify disease activity using standardized MRI indices.
